title: Augusta County: John Quincy Adams Nadenbousch to Hester J. Nadenbousch, August 23, 1864
summary: Nadenbousch writes his wife and describes the difficulties he has had in attempting to go home for a visit. He encourages his wife to leave their property to chance, and move to Staunton. He explains that he cannot come home permanently for fear of arrest by the Federals. He also informs her he is sending her an Irish servant girl, and itemizes the goods lost on his last journey to Staunton.
keywords: Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
